# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for your requirement:
```julia
function wrap_string(words::Array{String, 1}, text_width::Int=10)
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            result *= line
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " "
        line *= word
    end
    result *= "\n"
    result *= line
    return result
end
```
You can use the function as follows:
```julia
words = ["Lorem", "ipsum", "dolor", "sit", "amet,", "consectetur", "adipiscing", "elit."]
println(wrap_string(words))
```
This will output:
```plaintext
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit amet,
consectetur adipiscing elit.
```
